file_content.text: The Condemned may be pacified, but there are still plenty of other prisoners on the rampage.
Kill every last one of them.
It's too late. We held them off for a while, but they broke through. Most of our personnel fell back to the armory, but Kelsa....
She was a model officer... those animals cut her down without a second thought.
Would've been a massacre if you hadn't warned us about that disruptor. They'll die for this--the Condemned, the Imperials... and Nyranos.
I thought you wanted to resolve all this without violence.
Where's your restraint?
I've exhausted my mercy. If those maniacs want a bloodbath, I say we give it to them.
Are you wounded?
Don't worry about me. I'll live.
I'll hunt down every last one of them.
I'll get them for you.
Do what you have to do.
They're barricaded in the control room. We prevented them from slicing the central terminal remotely--now they're trying to access it manually.
I saved one of the magnetar rifles for you. Should get you through the security fields. Get in there and finish this.
I saved a few magnetar rifles for you. Should get you through the security fields. Get in there and finish this.
It's high time we restored order to this place.
Good news--we finally have a lead on the Condemned's ringleader. Found this holorecording on one of Playt's assassins. Take a look.
Brothers, sisters--I am Nyranos. Like you, I was born into captivity, shackled by the crimes of my ancestors.
Our forefathers rot in the bowels of this prison, their debt to the Republic repaid in full. Yet here we remain, guiltless.
We must stand united against this injustice. Together, we will tear down these walls and seize our freedom!
He goes on from there, but you get the idea. This guy is bad news--he's cunning, ruthless, and worst of all, charismatic.
Sounds like he has every reason to be upset.
He actually has a point.
Don't buy into the whole "hero of the people" routine. He's injected just enough truth into his rants to rally his followers.
I'll take him.
Don't underestimate him. He was born and raised on Belsavis, and we don't breed pushovers here.
So we've got a name and a face. Doesn't bring us any closer to stopping him.
That wasn't much of a lead.
Actually, this little tirade told us more about him than we could have hoped for.
Nyranos is dangerous, but he's just a puppet. The Empire's been using him to provoke the inmates. Fortunately, they slipped up.
That's right. I isolated several audio cues from the recording and got a fix on its origin. Could be their headquarters.
This is the break we've been waiting for. Now that we know where they're hiding, we can finally take the fight to them.
The sooner we quell this riot, the better.
No time to waste.
Well said.
Why are Imperials fraternizing with convicts?
Why is the Empire involved?
The Empire's been egging them on in hopes of escalating the riots. May get more than they bargained for.
I've been itching for a little payback.
About time we hit them.
I hear that. Won't feel right until they've paid for Warden Playt's murder.
Nyranos and his Imperial cohorts are the brains behind the Condemned. We take them out, we end this riot.
Get to their hideout. If Nyranos is there, eliminate him; otherwise, find out what they're up to. Any insight could go a long way.
Hopefully the Force will provide an alternative to violence. You just stay here and keep an eye on the station.
I'll do what I can.
Will do.
Won't Nyranos's death just rile the prisoners even further?
Killing him could backfire.
I hate to make a martyr out of him, but letting him run loose is even riskier.
Hopefully this Nyranos is there--I'll take a fighting mission over recon any day.
I like the first option.
In that case, good hunting.
I can't wait to see the look on their faces when I roll in there.
This'll be good.
I'm sorry I won't be around to see it.
Will do.
Why me?
Too overt. They'll run if they think we're onto them.
Hang onto those stun grenades Kelsa gave you. Kill the Imperials if you like, but again, I'd prefer the prisoners were subdued non-lethally.
Contact me when you've cleared out the base. I'll be waiting for your report.
Welcome back. Glad to see you made it--and with all the rifles, no less.
I appreciate you keeping the body count to a minimum. Last thing we need is to provoke the rioters even further.
With the shield generator online and the magnetar rifles back in our hands, we'll be safe for a while. Thank you.
Any other weapons I should be worried about the prisoners getting their hands on?
No more surprises?
Just the usual assortment of blasters and vibroblades.
My pleasure.
You're proving yourself a real asset around here.
I know. I'm amazing.
Wish I had fifty more like you.
On that note, I just received intel from Republic Command that those Condemned lunatics have already responded to our shield restoration.
They just hit another armory. This one's unique, though--stocked with all kinds of prototype weaponry, including our new magnetar rifles.
I'm assuming that's a weapon of some kind?
Magnetar rifles?
More or less.
I take it we don't want a horde of angry prisoners getting their hands on these rifles?
I'll assume that's bad.
Got that right.
Not ringing any bells. Must be some kind of new ordnance.
Magnetar rifles?
They're cutting edge, all right.
A magna-whatsit?
Magnetar rifles?
Not surprised you haven't heard of them. Few have.
How does this affect the station's security?
What's the big deal?
Worst-case scenario? The station won't have any security.
Those prisoners really have the run of the place, don't they?
This has to stop.
Told you it was bad. This latest development certainly doesn't help.
The magnetar rifles were specifically designed to disrupt energy shields. The technology's experimental, but effective.
Our security fields won't last against one of those things. A single shot takes a while to load up, but it could punch right through our defenses.
Send me the armory's coordinates. I'll deal with the Condemned myself.
I'll secure those rifles.
Send us the armory's coordinates. We'll deal with the Condemned ourselves.
We'll secure those rifles.
Just make sure you get all the weapons--a single unaccounted rifle could compromise the station's security.
Why would you even carry that kind of weaponry?
Odd thing for you to have.
Kept a few on hand after some prisoners got loose and barricaded themselves in their cells. Never thought they might be used against us.
How is this a surprise? Of course they'd go after a shield-destroying weapon.
You didn't expect this?
Did we anticipate it was possible? Yes. Did we have the manpower to do anything about it? No.
I need you to get to that armory and secure those weapons. Those maniacs escape with even one rifle, it's over for us.
Bring the rifles back to the station once you've retrieved them. Graal out.
Try not to kill anyone, if you can. There's been enough death already.
Here, these stun grenades should take the fight out of them.
That'll do. Bring the rifles back to the station once you've retrieved them. Graal, out.
Graal, here. Looks like that did it--the security fields just went up. And not a moment too soon.
Even better, that boost jump-started the station's internal generators. We're rerouting power to them now.
That means the prisoners won't be able to knock out the fields again, right?
So the station's secure?
For the time being.
Excellent.
We're not in the clear yet, but it's a start.
We've got a lot more work cut out for us, don't we?
This is just the beginning.
Afraid so.
You did good. And thank you for looking after Kelsa. She's only a junior corrections officer--I'd hate to see anything happen to her.
Get Kelsa to that generator in one piece. I'm counting on you.
Seal off the wing! No one gets in or out without my say-so. Kelsa--how's the warden?
Dead, sir. Clean shot to the head. I think that makes you the new warden.
Ah. I... hadn't thought of that....
Now isn't the time for doubt, warden. These people need you.
You can do this.
Playt wouldn't have chosen you as his successor if he didn't trust you.
You'll do fine.
I suppose you're right.
The chain of command is there for a reason, warden. Time to buck up and take charge.
Accept your responsibility.
All right. I'll do what I can for now.
Congrats on the promotion. Too bad about Playt, though.
Always a silver lining.
Playt may have been a bit of a curmudgeon, but he performed his duties admirably.
How'd those prisoners even get in here?
Your security is lacking.
Like Playt said, our defenses are pretty much nil right now. Didn't realize just how vulnerable we were, though.
Quit stalling and give us a game plan.
Less talk. More action.
Sorry, this is just... unexpected. The warden was a good man.
Securing this station is our first priority--another ambush like that and we're through.
Our security fields should keep the prisoners out. But some Condemned saboteurs trashed the field generator-- the whole network is down.
Leave it to me, sir. A few tools, a little elbow grease, and I'll have that generator back up in no time.
That generator could still be crawling with prisoners. I'd feel a lot better knowing someone was watching her back.
She'll be safe. You have my word.
Leave it to me.
I'll hold you to that.
You've got guards. Have them escort her.
One of you can't do it?
Until those fields are up, I need all security personnel defending the station. Afraid that just leaves you.
Just let me slip into something more blaster-resistant.
The generator isn't far. Just keep those lunatics away from Kelsa. Give 'em one for the warden.
That's more like it. I'll be waiting for you just outside the station. Come get me when you're ready to head out.
Won't be me. [Refuse quest]
Cancel that, Kelsa. I don't want you going out there alone.
That should do it. Throw the switch and cross your fingers.
This is pathetic.
